client_token.description: The client token that ensures idempotency. Two create calls with the same client token will receive the same vApp object. The client token must be a valid UUID.

placement_reqs.description: Extensible description of the vApp's requirements used to place the vApp correctly at create time.

config_spec.description: vApp configuration spec containing creation parameters. Extensible to support extensions hooking into the vApp create method.

client_token.description: The client token that ensures idempotency. Two create calls with the same client token will receive the same vApp object. The client token must be a valid UUID.

eulas.description:
End User License Agreements.

Defaults to the empty list

product.description:
Information about the content of the vApp.

This is described as a map of entries each indexed by a unique product key. The key is as follows:

  • For default product: 'product'
  • If both classId and instanceId are set: 'product-<classId>.<instanceId>'
  • If either classId or instanceId are set: 'product-<classId>' or 'product-<instanceId>'
Where 'classId' and 'instanceId' are the same as described in the {@link ProductSpec} class.

Unless 'classId' and 'instanceId' are both unset, the values must match the key in the map according to the above described format.

When a ProductSpec is created and 'classId' is not specified in the product itself, it is assigned the part after 'product-' of the map key. 'instanceId' is assigned the empty string.

For example if the map key is 'product-a.b' then 'classId' is assigned 'a.b'.

By default the "product" product section always exists.

Removal of product is specified by setting the product's key as the key, with the value in the Map set to null.

ip_assignment.description:
Specifies the IP assignment schemes supported on this vApp.

Defaults to an {@link IpAssignment} with all attributes set to default values.

property.description:
A map of properties indexed with the fully-qualified id.

The key for the property is of the form:
'property-[<classId.>]id[<.instanceId>]'

Where 'classId', 'id, and 'instanceId' are the same as described in the {@link PropertySpec} class.

Unless 'classId', 'id, and 'instanceId' are all unset, the values must match the key in the map according the above described format.

When a PropertySpec is created and 'id' is not specified in the property itself, 'id' is assigned the part after 'property-' of the map key. 'classId' and 'instanceId' is assigned the empty string.

For example if the map key is 'property-a.b.c' then 'id' is assigned 'a.b.c'.

Defaults to the empty map.

Removal of property is specified by setting the property key as the key, with the value in the Map set to null.

customization.description: The customization model for the vApp

id.description: Id of the vApp. Generated on create.

description.description: vApp description. Defaults to the empty string.

resource_pool_id.description:
The parent resource pool of the vApp.

A vApp that has a parent resource pool is not part of a VDC. When creating a vApp exactly one of the fields vdcId and resourcePoolId must be set. When reading the VAppModel only the corresponding field is set.

vdc_id.description:
The VDC, which this vApp is part of.

A vApp that is part of a VDC does not have a parent resource pool. When creating a vApp exactly one of the fields vdcId and resourcePoolId must be set. When reading the VAppModel only the corresponding field is set.

start_delay_seconds.description:
Delay before starting the next group. The value must be 0 or higher, and less than 2147483648.

This field is not used for vApps.

Default value for VMs is 120.

stop_action.description: What to do when the containing vApp is stopped

start_action.description: What to do when the containing vApp is started

start_order.description:
Specifies the start order for this VM or vApp. VMs and vApps are started from lower numbers to higher numbers and reverse on shutdown. Multiple objects with the same start order can be started in parallel and the order is unspecified. This value must be 0 or higher, and less than 2147483648.

Default value is depending on the containing vApp and what other entities it contains. If the containing vApp only contains this VM or vApp the value is 1, otherwise it is 1 larger than the largest startOrder for any other VM or vApp in the containing vApp.

waiting_for_guest.description:
Flag indicating if a VM should be considered started when a heartbeat is received from the guest.

The startup of a vApp will proceed with the next group (as defined by startOrder) when either it has waited for the time specified by startDelaySeconds or a heartbeat from the guest is received.

This field is not used for vApps.

The default value for VMs is false.

stop_delay_seconds.description:
Delay before vApp shutdown will proceed to stop the next group. The value must be 0 or higher, and less than 2147483648.

This field is not used for vApps.

Default value for VMs is 120.

shares.description: Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints.

limit.description: The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure consistent performance of virtual machines independent of available resources. Units are in MHz.

reservation.description: Amount of resources that are guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are in MHz.

type.description: The type of controller.

device_id.description: The device identifier for the disk controller. This is a string in the form: {@code scsi<x>} for a SCSI controller, or {@code sata<x>} for a SATA controller.

pci_slot_number.description: The PCI slot number location of this controller.

com.vmware.vcenter.vdcs.disk_controller_.description: The {@name DiskControllerType} {@term enumerated type} defines disk controller types.

device_id.description: The device identifier for the disk. The device identifier identifies both the disk in the virtual machine and its controller type. It is of the form: {@code ide<x>:<y>}, {@code scsi<x>:<y>}, {@code sata<x>:<y>} where {@code x} is the bus number on the controller of specified type and {@code y} is the unit number of the device on the specified bus.

datastore_id.description: Identifier of datastore or storage pod for the virtual disk.

disk_id.description:
Identifier which identifies the actual disk.

{@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID#type} is the value of {@link #VMDK_DISK_TYPE} or {@link #RDM_DISK_TYPE}, and {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID#id} is the value for this type of resource.

For example,

VMDK disk:

  • {@code diskId.type="com.vmware.vcenter.storage.DatstoreFile"}
  • {@code diskId.id="[ds-25]5240b16d-d66ffc79-7f41-00505691c32c/win8/win8.vmdk"}

RDM disk:

  • {@code diskId.type="com.vmware.vcenter.storage.RdmDisk"}
  • {@code diskId.id="[ds-45]072390ec-45f145ca-be54-2bb67af6da91/linux/linux.rdm"}

capacity.description: Capacity of this virtual disk in bytes.

persistence_mode.description:
Persistence mode of the disk.

The set of persistence modes supported by a virtual disk is dependent on the type of storage backing used for the disk.

storage_profile.description: Storage profile for the disk. If not specified, no change is made, that is, the disk retains its storage profile association, if it had one. Specifying the Storage Profile identifier as an empty string signifies that the disk should no longer be associated with a storage profile if it already was. This doesn't apply to certain disk types such RDM passthrough disk.

ip_allocation_policy.description: Specifies how IP allocation is done for this virtual appliance. This is typically specified by the deployer of the virtual appliance. The set of valid options for the policy is based on the capabilities of the virtual appliance software, as specified by the {@link #supportedAllocationScheme} {@term field}.

supported_ip_protocol.description:
Specifies the IP protocols supported by the guest software. This {@term field} is often configured by the virtual appliance template author or OVF package author to describe what IP protocols are supported by the virtual appliance's virtual machines.
The specific IP protocol for a virtual appliance is set via the {@link #ipProtocol} {@term field} by the deployer of the virtual appliance.

supported_allocation_scheme.description:
Specifies the IP allocation schemes supported by the guest operating system. This {@term field} defines what the valid values are for {@link #ipAllocationPolicy}. This setting is often configured by the virtual appliance template author or OVF package author to reflect what the guest operating system supports, and the {@link #ipAllocationPolicy} is configured at deployment time.

The below table describes what IP allocation policies are supported for a given IP allocation scheme.
IP Allocation Scheme IP Allocation Policy
DHCP DHCP
OVF_ENVIRONMENT TRANSIENT, FIXED, FIXED_ALLOCATED

ip_protocol.description: Specifies the chosen IP protocol for this deployment. This must be one of the values in the {@link #supportedIpProtocol} {@term field}.

com.vmware.vcenter.vdcs.ip_assignment.al.description: The {@name AllocationScheme} {@term enumerated type} defines IP allocation schemes supported by the guest.

com.vmware.vcenter.vdcs.ip_assignment.ip.description: The {@name IpAllocationPolicy} {@term enumerated type} defines IP allocation policies for a deployment.

com.vmware.vcenter.vdcs.ip_assignment.pr.description: The {@name Protocol} {@term enumerated type} defines IP protocols supported by the guest.

shares.description: Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints. Memory shares are used in case of resource contention.

limit.description: The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure consistent performance of virtual machines independent of available resources. Units are in MB.

reservation.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are in MB.

full_version.description: Full-version of the product, for example, {@code 1.0-build 12323}.

app_url.description: URL to entry-point for application. This is defined as a {@term string} as it is often specified using a macro, for example, {@code http:///}, where {@code app.ip} is a defined property on the virtual machine or virtual appliance container.

instance_id.description:
Instance identifier for this product.

This {@term field} combined with the {@link #classId} {@term field} uniquely identifies this product section and is used to correlate the OVF properties with the corresponding product information.

Valid values for {@code instanceId}: Any {@term string} except any whitespace characters.

version.description: Short version of the product, for example, {@code 1.0}.

class_id.description:
Class identifier for this product.

This {@term field} combined with the {@link #instanceId} {@term field} uniquely identifies this product section and is used to correlate the OVF properties with the corresponding product information.

Valid values for {@code classId}: Any {@term string} except any whitespace characters.

id.description:
Identifier of this property. In the OVF environment, the property is listed as {@code [classId].[id].[instanceId]}. The {@code [classId].[id].[instanceId]} must be unique.

This field cannot be empty for a property. Thus, it must be specified at creation and cannot be set to the empty {@term string}.

Valid values for {@code id}: Any {@term string} except any white-space characters.

type.description:
Describes the valid format of the property.

A type must be one of:

  • {@code string} : A generic {@term string}. Max length 65535 (64k).
  • {@code string(x..)} : A {@term string} with minimum character length {@code x}.
  • {@code string(..y)} : A {@term string} with maximum character length {@code y}.
  • {@code string(x..y)} : A {@term string} with minimum character length {@code x} and maximum character length {@code y}.
  • {@code string["choice1", "choice2", "choice3"]} : A choice between a fixed set of options. The slash character ({@code \}) is used to escape quote ({@code "}) and slash ({@code \}), for example, {@code "start\"middle\"end"} and {@code "start\\end"}.
  • {@code int} : An integer value. Is semantically equivalent to {@code int(-2147483648..2147483647)}, for example, signed int32.
  • {@code int(x..y)}: An integer value with a minimum size {@code x} and a maximum size {@code y}. For example {@code int(0..255)} is a number between 0 and 255 both inclusive. This is also a way to specify that the number must be a uint8. There is always a lower and an upper bound. Max number of digits is 100 including any sign. If exported to OVF the value will be truncated to max of uint64 or int64.
  • {@code real} : IEEE 8-byte floating-point value.
  • {@code real(x..y)} : IEEE 8-byte floating-point value with a minimum size {@code x} and a maximum size {@code y}. For example {@code real(-1.5..1.5)} must be a number between -1.5 and 1.5. Because of the nature of float, some conversions can truncate the value. Real must be encoded acording to the Common Information Model (CIM) standard:

    RealValue = [ "+" | "-" ] *decimalDigit "." 1*decimalDigit [ ("e" | "E" ) [ "+" | "-" ] 1*decimalDigit ] ]

  • {@code boolean} : A {@term boolean}. The value can be true or false.
  • {@code password} : A generic {@term string}. Max length 65535 (64k).
  • {@code password(x..)} : A {@term string} with minimum character length {@code x}.
  • {@code password(..y)} : A {@term string} with maximum character length {@code y}.
  • {@code password(x..y)} : A {@term string} with minimum character length {@code x} and maximum character length {@code y}.
  • {@code ip} : An IPv4 address in dot-decimal notation or an IPv6 address in colon-hexadecimal notation.
  • {@code ip:network} : An IP address in dot-notation (IPv4) and colon-hexadecimal (IPv6) on a particular network. The behavior of this type depends on the {@link IpAssignment#ipAllocationPolicy}.
  • {@code expression} : The default value specifies an expression that is calculated by the system. See details below.

For properties of type {@code password}, the value field and default value field will always be returned as an empty {@term string} when queried. Thus, it is a write-only property. Typically, a client application will also render these as a text field with hidden text and double prompting.

An expression follows the general patterns of either {@code ${arg}} or {@code ${cmd:arg}}. The list of supported expressions are listed below:

  • {@code ${}} : This expression evaluates to the same value as the named property in the parent virtual appliance. A parent virtual appliance is the first virtual appliance in the ancestry chain (resource pools are skipped). If no parent virtual appliance exists or the property is not defined on the parent virtual appliance, the expression evaluates to the empty value.
  • {@code ${subnet:network}} : The subnet value of the given network.
  • {@code ${netmask:network}} : The netmask value of the given network.
  • {@code ${gateway:network}} : The gateway value of the given network.
  • {@code ${autoIp:network}} : An auto-assigned network address on the given network.
  • {@code ${net:network}} : The name of the network.
  • {@code ${domainName:network}} : The DNS domain name, for example, {@code vmware.com}, of the given network.
  • {@code ${searchPath:network}} : The DNS search path with paths delimited by a semicolon, for example, {@code eng.vmware.com;vmware.com}, of the given network.
  • {@code ${hostPrefix:network}} : The host prefix on a given network, for example, {@code "voe-"}.
  • {@code ${dns:network}} : A comma-separated {@term string} of configured network addresses.
  • {@code ${httpProxy:network}} : The {@code hostname:port} for a proxy on the network.
  • {@code ${vimIp:}} : The IP address of the VIM API provider server. This would typically be an ESX Server or vCenter Server.

A virtual appliance will fail to start if any of the properties cannot be computed. For example, if a property references a gateway on a network for which no gateway was configured. The computed value is assigned to the {@link #value} field upon start of the virtual appliance or virtual machine. The value is cleared once the virtual appliance or virtual machine is not running.

The system provides three ways of specifying IP addresses:

  • {@code ip}
  • {@code ip:network}
  • {@code ${ip:network}} expression.

The {@code ip} type is typically used to specify an IP addressed to an external system. Thus, these are not used by a virtual ethernet adapter within the guest itself. Both the {@code ip:network} and the {@code ${ip:network}} expressions are intended as a way to obtain an IP address for a virtual machine.

class_id.description:
Class identifier for this property.

This field combined with the {@link #id} and {@link #instanceId} fields uniquely identifies this property. The format of the identifier is of the form: {@code [classId].[id].[instanceId]}.

This is also used to correlate the property to a corresponding product information structure.

Valid values for {@code classId}: Any {@term string} except any whitespace characters.

label.description: The display name for the property.

instance_id.description:
Instance identifier for this property.

This field combined with the {@link #id} and {@link #classId} fields uniquely identifies this property. The format of the identifier is of the form: {@code [classId].[id].[instanceId]}.

This is also used to correlate the property to a corresponding product information structure.

Valid values for {@code instanceId}: Any {@term string} except any whitespace characters.

category.description: If this is set to a non-empty {@term string}, this property starts a new category. If the category is empty, the property is in the same category as the previous item. Previous is based on the value of the order field.

default_value.description:
Either contains the default value of a field (used if value is an empty {@term string}), or the expression if the type is {@code "expression"}.

See documentation on {@link #type} for more details.

value.description:
The value of the field at deployment time. For expressions, this will contain the value that has been computed.

Updates of this value are ignored if the type is {@code "expression"}.

ui_optional.description: Whether a category is UI optional. This is only used if this property starts a new category.

user_configurable.description: Whether the property is user-configurable or a system property. This is not used if the type is expression.

shares.description:
The number of shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. This value is only set if level is set to {@link SharesLevel#CUSTOM}. Otherwise, it is ignored. Therefore, only shares with custom values can be compared.

There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other virtual machines.

level.description: The simplified view of shares for allocation level. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as {@link SharesLevel#CUSTOM}.

com.vmware.vcenter.vdcs.shares_info.shar.description: The {@name SharesLevel} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of share levels. These designations have different meanings for different resources.

vbs_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not Virtualization-based security is enabled for the virtual machine.

cpu_hot_remove_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not virtual processors can be removed from the virtual machine while it is running.

memory_hot_add_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not memory can be added to the virtual machine while it is running.

vvtd_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not Intel Virtualization Technology for Directed I/O is enabled for the virtual machine.

num_cpus.description: Number of virtual processors in the virtual machine.

num_cores_per_socket.description: Number of cores among which to distribute CPUs in the virtual machine.

cpu_hot_add_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not virtual processors can be added to the virtual machine while it is running.

nested_hardware_virtualization.description: Expose hardware virtualization to the guest VM if available.

firmware.description: Information about firmware type for this Virtual Machine, Possible values are: "bios", "efi", and "csm".

virtual_SMC_present.description: Does this virtual machine have System Management Controller

efi_secure_boot_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the virtual machine's firmware will perform signature checks of any EFI images loaded during startup.

virtual_IC_h7m_present.description: Does this virtual machine have Virtual Intel I/O Controller Hub 7

compute.description: The model to be used for updating compute related settings of the virtual machine.

install_boot_required.description: Indicates that the virtual machine needs to be booted once before the deployment is complete.

install_boot_stop_delay.description: Specifies the delay in seconds to wait for the virtual machine to power off after the initial boot. Only used if {@link #installBootRequired} is true.

product.description:
Information about the content of the virtual machine.

This is described as a {@term map} of entries each indexed by a unique product key. The key is of the form:
{@code product-[classId].[instanceId]}

Where {@code classId} and {@code instanceId} correspond to {@link ProductSpec#classId} and {@link ProductSpec#instanceId} respectively.

The above format implies the default product is indexed by the {@code product} key since both the {@code classId} and the {@code instanceId} are empty.

Removal of a product is specified by setting the product's key as the key, with the value in the {@term map} set to {@term unset}.

ip_assignment.description: Specifies the IP assignment schemes supported on this virtual machine. {@link IpAssignment} has an {@link IpAssignment.AllocationScheme} which defines various values.

property.description:
A {@term map} of properties indexed with the fully-qualified identifier.

The key for the property is of the form:
{@code property-[classId].[id].[instanceId]}

Where {@code classId} and {@code instanceId} correspond to {@link PropertySpec#classId} and {@link PropertySpec#instanceId} respectively.

Removal of a property is specified by setting the property key as the key, with the value in the {@term map} set to {@term unset}.

customization_settings.description: The customization related settings of the virtual machine to update.

storage_profile_id.description: Identifier of storage profile for the virtual machine home. Specifying the storage profile identifier as an empty string signifies that the virtual machine home should no longer be associated with a storage profile if it already was.

datastore_id.description: Identifier of datastore or storage pod for the virtual machine home.

disk_controllers.description: {@term Map} of {@link DiskControllerModel}, keyed by device identifier. Refer to the {@link DiskControllerModel} documentation for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@name DiskControllerModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the {@link DiskControllerModel} itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link DiskControllerModel} itself can be left unset. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the device identifier of the device to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

disks.description: {@term Map} of {@link DiskModel}, keyed by device identifier. Refer to the {@link DiskModel} for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the disk's device identifier, and the device identifier in the Disk itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the disk itself can be left unset. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the device identifier of the device to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

vm_storage.description: The updated storage related settings for the virtual machine.

status.description: The compliance status of the policy on a specified object. Warning: This attribute is available as technical preview. It may be changed in a future release.

type.description: The type of virtual machine console ticket. Warning: This attribute is available as technical preview. It may be changed in a future release.

ticket.description: Console ticket URI. Warning: This attribute is available as technical preview. It may be changed in a future release.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.console.tickets.ty.description: The Tickets.Type enumerated type defines the types of console tickets. Warning: This enumeration is available as technical preview. It may be changed in a future release.

spec.description: Specification for the console ticket to be created.

ip_address.description:
IP address assigned by the guest operating system.
If unset the guest does not have an IP address.

host_name.description: Hostname of the guest operating system.

capacity.description: Total capacity of the file system, in bytes.

free_space.description: Free space on the file system, in bytes.

state.description: The power state of the guest operating system.

operations_ready.description: Flag indicating if the virtual machine is ready to process soft power operations.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.guest_OS.description: The GuestOS enumerated type defines the valid guest operating system types used for configuring a virtual machine.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.guest_OS_family.description: The GuestOSFamily enumerated type defines the valid guest operating system family types reported by a virtual machine.

type.description:
Adapter type.
If unset, a guest-specific default value will be used.

pci_slot_number.description:
Address of the SATA adapter on the PCI bus.
If unset, the server will choose an available address when the virtual machine is powered on.

bus.description:
SATA bus number.
If unset, the server will choose an available bus number; if none is available, the request will fail.

type.description: Adapter type.

pci_slot_number.description:
Address of the SATA adapter on the PCI bus.
May be unset if the virtual machine has never been powered on since the adapter was created.

adapter.description:
Identifier of the virtual SATA adapter.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.SataAdapter. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.SataAdapter.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.adapter.s.description: The Sata.Type enumerated type defines the valid emulation types for a virtual SATA adapter.

spec.description: Specification for the new virtual SATA adapter.

type.description:
Adapter type.
If unset, a guest-specific default value will be used.

pci_slot_number.description:
Address of the SCSI adapter on the PCI bus. If the PCI address is invalid, the server will change it when the VM is started or as the device is hot added.
If unset, the server will choose an available address when the virtual machine is powered on.

bus.description:
SCSI bus number.
If unset, the server will choose an available bus number; if none is available, the request will fail.

sharing.description:
Bus sharing mode.
If unset, the adapter will default to NONE.

type.description: Adapter type.

scsi.description: Address of the SCSI adapter on the SCSI bus.

Address of the SCSI adapter on the PCI bus. If the PCI address is invalid, the server will change it when the VM is started or as the device is hot added.
May be unset if the virtual machine has never been powered on since the adapter was created.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.adapter.s.description: The Scsi.Sharing enumerated type defines the valid bus sharing modes for a virtual SCSI adapter.

adapter.description:
Identifier of the virtual SCSI adapter.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ScsiAdapter. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ScsiAdapter.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.adapter.s.description: The Scsi.Type enumerated type defines the valid emulation types for a virtual SCSI adapter.

sharing.description:
Bus sharing mode. 
 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is not powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

spec.description: Specification for the new virtual SCSI adapter.
Specification for updating the virtual SCSI adapter.

type.description:
Firmware type to be used by the virtual machine.
If unset, defaults to value that is recommended for the guest OS and is supported for the virtual hardware version.

enter_setup_mode.description:
Flag indicating whether the firmware boot process should automatically enter setup mode the next time the virtual machine boots. Note that this flag will automatically be reset to false once the virtual machine enters setup mode.
If unset, the value is unchanged.

efi_legacy_boot.description:
Flag indicating whether to use EFI legacy boot mode.
If unset, defaults to value that is recommended for the guest OS and is supported for the virtual hardware version.

retry.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual machine should automatically retry the boot process after a failure.
If unset, default value is false.

network_protocol.description:
Protocol to use when attempting to boot the virtual machine over the network.
If unset, defaults to a system defined default value.

retry_delay.description:
Delay in milliseconds before retrying the boot process after a failure; applicable only when Boot.Info.retry is true.
If unset, default value is 10000.

delay.description:
Delay in milliseconds before beginning the firmware boot process when the virtual machine is powered on. This delay may be used to provide a time window for users to connect to the virtual machine console and enter BIOS setup mode.
If unset, default value is 0.

type.description: Virtual device type.

nic.description:
Virtual Ethernet device. Ethernet device to use as boot device for this entry.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Device.Entry.type is ETHERNET.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet.

disks.description:
Virtual disk device. List of virtual disks in boot order.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Device.Entry.type is DISK.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual CD-ROM device.

auto_detect.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual CD-ROM device is configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Cdrom.BackingInfo.type is HOST_DEVICE.

host_device.description:
Name of the host device backing the virtual CD-ROM device. 


This field will be unset if Cdrom.BackingInfo.auto-detect is true and the virtual CD-ROM device is not connected or no suitable device is available on the host.

iso_file.description:
Path of the image file backing the virtual CD-ROM device.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Cdrom.BackingInfo.type is ISO_FILE.

device_access_type.description:
Access type for the device backing.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Cdrom.BackingInfo.type is one of HOST_DEVICE or CLIENT_DEVICE.

count.description:
New number of CPU cores. The number of CPU cores in the virtual machine must be a multiple of the number of cores per socket. 
 The supported range of CPU counts is constrained by the configured guest operating system and virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. 

 If the virtual machine is running, the number of CPU cores may only be increased if Cpu.Info.hot-add-enabled is true, and may only be decreased if Cpu.Info.hot-remove-enabled is true.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is powered off.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

hot_add_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether adding CPUs while the virtual machine is running is enabled. 
 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is powered off.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

cores_per_socket.description:
New number of CPU cores per socket. The number of CPU cores in the virtual machine must be a multiple of the number of cores per socket.
If unset, the value is unchanged.

vmdk_file.description:
Path of the VMDK file backing the virtual disk.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Disk.BackingSpec.type is VMDK_FILE.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.disk.back.description: The Disk.BackingType enumerated type defines the valid backing types for a virtual disk.

type.description:
Type of host bus adapter to which the device should be attached.
If unset, guest-specific default values will be used

new_vmdk.description:
Specification for creating a new VMDK backing for the virtual disk. Exactly one of Disk.CreateSpec.backing or Disk.CreateSpec.new-vmdk must be specified.
If unset, a new VMDK backing will not be created.

backing.description:
Existing physical resource backing for the virtual disk. Exactly one of Disk.CreateSpec.backing or Disk.CreateSpec.new-vmdk must be specified.
If unset, the virtual disk will not be connected to an existing backing.

scsi.description:
Address for attaching the device to a virtual SCSI adapter.
If unset, the server will choose an available address; if none is available, the request will fail.

ide.description:
Address for attaching the device to a virtual IDE adapter.
If unset, the server will choose an available address; if none is available, the request will fail.

sata.description:
Address for attaching the device to a virtual SATA adapter.
If unset, the server will choose an available address; if none is available, the request will fail.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.disk.host.description: The Disk.HostBusAdapterType enumerated type defines the valid types of host bus adapters that may be used for attaching a virtual storage device to a virtual machine.

type.description: Type of host bus adapter to which the device is attached.

backing.description: Physical resource backing for the virtual disk.

scsi.description:
Address of device attached to a virtual SCSI adapter.
Workaround for PR1459646

capacity.description:
Capacity of the virtual disk in bytes.
If unset, virtual disk is inaccessible or disk capacity is 0.

ide.description:
Address of device attached to a virtual IDE adapter.
Workaround for PR1459646

sata.description:
Address of device attached to a virtual SATA adapter.
Workaround for PR1459646

policy.description:
Identifier of the storage policy which should be associated with the VMDK file.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy.

disk.description:
Identifier of the virtual Disk.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

backing.description:
Physical resource backing for the virtual disk. 
 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is not powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

capacity.description:
Capacity of the virtual disk backing in bytes.
If unset, defaults to a guest-specific capacity.

storage_policy.description:
The Disk.StoragePolicySpec structure contains information about the storage policy that is to be associated the with VMDK file.
If unset the default storage policy of the target datastore (if applicable) is applied. Currently a default storage policy is only supported by object based datastores : VVol & vSAN. For non- object datastores, if unset then no storage policy would be associated with the VMDK file.

name.description:
Base name of the VMDK file. The name should not include the '.vmdk' file extension.
If unset, a name (derived from the name of the virtual machine) will be chosen by the server.

spec.description: Specification for the new virtual disk.
Specification for updating the virtual disk.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual Ethernet adapter.

host_device.description:
Name of the device backing the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingInfo.type is HOST_DEVICE.

distributed_port.description:
Key of the distributed virtual port that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field will be unset if the virtual Ethernet device is not bound to a distributed virtual port; this can happen if the virtual machine is powered off or the virtual Ethernet device is not connected.

network_name.description:
Name of the standard portgroup backing the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingInfo.type is STANDARD_PORTGROUP.

distributed_switch_uuid.description:
UUID of the distributed virtual switch that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingInfo.type is DISTRIBUTED_PORTGROUP.

opaque_network_type.description:
Type of the opaque network that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingInfo.type is OPAQUE_NETWORK.

network.description:
Identifier of the network backing the virtual Ethernet adapter.
If unset, the identifier of the network backing could not be determined.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Network. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Network.

connection_cookie.description:
Server-generated cookie that identifies the connection to the port. This ookie may be used to verify that the virtual machine is the rightful owner of the port.
This field will be unset if the virtual Ethernet device is not bound to a distributed virtual port; this can happen if the virtual machine is powered off or the virtual Ethernet device is not connected.

opaque_network_id.description:
Identifier of the opaque network that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingInfo.type is OPAQUE_NETWORK.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual Ethernet adapter.

network.description:
Identifier of the network that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.BackingSpec.type is one of STANDARD_PORTGROUP, DISTRIBUTED_PORTGROUP, or OPAQUE_NETWORK.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Network. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Network.

distributed_port.description:
Key of the distributed virtual port that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter. Depending on the type of the Portgroup, the port may be specified using this field. If the portgroup type is early-binding (also known as static), a port is assigned when the Ethernet adapter is configured to use the port. The port may be either automatically or specifically assigned based on the value of this field. If the portgroup type is ephemeral, the port is created and assigned to a virtual machine when it is powered on and the Ethernet adapter is connected. This field cannot be specified as no free ports exist before use.
May be used to specify a port when the network specified on the Ethernet.BackingSpec.network field is a static or early binding distributed portgroup. If unset, the port will be automatically assigned to the Ethernet adapter based on the policy embodied by the portgroup type.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ethernet..description: The Ethernet.BackingType enumerated type defines the valid backing types for a virtual Ethernet adapter.

type.description:
Ethernet adapter emulation type.
If unset, defaults to a guest-specific type.

backing.description:
Physical resource backing for the virtual Ethernet adapter.
If unset, the system may try to find an appropriate backing. If one is not found, the request will fail.

wake_on_lan_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether wake-on-LAN is enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter.
Defaults to false if unset.

pci_slot_number.description:
Address of the virtual Ethernet adapter on the PCI bus. If the PCI address is invalid, the server will change when it the VM is started or as the device is hot added.
If unset, the server will choose an available address when the virtual machine is powered on.

upt_compatibility_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether Universal Pass-Through (UPT) compatibility is enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter.
If unset, defaults to false.

mac_type.description:
MAC address type.
If unset, defaults to GENERATED.

allow_guest_control.description:
Flag indicating whether the guest can connect and disconnect the device.
Defaults to false if unset.

start_connected.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual device should be connected whenever the virtual machine is powered on.
Defaults to false if unset.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ethernet..description: The Ethernet.EmulationType enumerated type defines the valid emulation types for a virtual Ethernet adapter.

type.description: Ethernet adapter emulation type.

backing.description: Physical resource backing for the virtual Ethernet adapter.

wake_on_lan_enabled.description: Flag indicating whether wake-on-LAN is enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter.

mac_address.description:
MAC address.
May be unset if Ethernet.Info.mac-type is MANUAL and has not been specified, or if Ethernet.Info.mac-type is GENERATED and the virtual machine has never been powered on since the Ethernet adapter was created.

upt_compatibility_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether Universal Pass-Through (UPT) compatibility is enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ethernet.Info.type is VMXNET3.

pci_slot_number.description:
Address of the virtual Ethernet adapter on the PCI bus. If the PCI address is invalid, the server will change it when the VM is started or as the device is hot added.
May be unset if the virtual machine has never been powered on since the adapter was created.

allow_guest_control.description: Flag indicating whether the guest can connect and disconnect the device.

start_connected.description: Flag indicating whether the virtual device should be connected whenever the virtual machine is powered on.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ethernet..description: The Ethernet.MacAddressType enumerated type defines the valid MAC address origins for a virtual Ethernet adapter.

nic.description:
Identifier of the virtual Ethernet adapter.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet.

backing.description:
Physical resource backing for the virtual Ethernet adapter. 
 This field may be modified at any time, and changes will be applied the next time the virtual machine is powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

wake_on_lan_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether wake-on-LAN shoud be enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter. 
 This field may be modified at any time, and changes will be applied the next time the virtual machine is powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

mac_address.description:
MAC address. 
 This field may be modified at any time, and changes will be applied the next time the virtual machine is powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged. Must be specified if Ethernet.UpdateSpec.mac-type is MANUAL. Must be unset if the MAC address type is not MANUAL.

upt_compatibility_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether Universal Pass-Through (UPT) compatibility should be enabled on this virtual Ethernet adapter. 
 This field may be modified at any time, and changes will be applied the next time the virtual machine is powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged. Must be unset if the emulation type of the virtual Ethernet adapter is not VMXNET3.

mac_type.description:
MAC address type. 
 This field may be modified at any time, and changes will be applied the next time the virtual machine is powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

allow_guest_control.description:
Flag indicating whether the guest can connect and disconnect the device.
If unset, the value is unchanged.

start_connected.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual device should be connected whenever the virtual machine is powered on.
If unset, the value is unchanged.

spec.description: Specification for the new virtual Ethernet adapter.
Specification for updating the virtual Ethernet adapter.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual floppy drive.

auto_detect.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual floppy drive is configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Floppy.BackingInfo.type is HOST_DEVICE.

host_device.description:
Name of the host device backing the virtual floppy drive. 


This field will be unset if Floppy.BackingInfo.auto-detect is true and the virtual floppy drive is not connected or no suitable device is available on the host.

image_file.description:
Path of the image file backing the virtual floppy drive.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Floppy.BackingInfo.type is IMAGE_FILE.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual floppy drive.

host_device.description:
Name of the device that should be used as the virtual floppy drive backing.
If unset, the virtual floppy drive will be configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.

image_file.description:
Path of the image file that should be used as the virtual floppy drive backing.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Floppy.BackingSpec.type is IMAGE_FILE.

Defaults to false if unset.

When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Floppy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Floppy.

Physical resource backing for the virtual floppy drive. 
 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is not powered on or the virtual floppy drive is not connected.

master.description: Flag specifying whether the device is the master or slave device on the IDE adapter.

primary.description: Flag specifying whether the device is attached to the primary or secondary IDE adapter of the virtual machine.

master.description:
Flag specifying whether the device should be the master or slave device on the IDE adapter.
If unset, the server will choose an available connection type. If no IDE connections are available, the request will be rejected.

primary.description:
Flag specifying whether the device should be attached to the primary or secondary IDE adapter of the virtual machine.
If unset, the server will choose a adapter with an available connection. If no IDE connections are available, the request will be rejected.

upgrade_error.description:
Reason for the scheduled upgrade failure.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Hardware.Info.upgrade-status is FAILED.

upgrade_version.description:
Target hardware version to be used on the next scheduled virtual hardware upgrade.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Hardware.Info.upgrade-policy is one of AFTER_CLEAN_SHUTDOWN or ALWAYS.

hot_add_limit_MiB.description:
The maximum amount of memory, in mebibytes, that can be added to a running virtual machine.
Only set when Memory.Info.hot-add-enabled is true and the virtual machine is running.

hot_add_increment_size_MiB.description:
The granularity, in mebibytes, at which memory can be added to a running virtual machine. 
 When adding memory to a running virtual machine, the amount of memory added must be at least Memory.Info.hot-add-increment-size-mib and the total memory size of the virtual machine must be a multiple of {@link>hotAddIncrementSize}.

Only set when Memory.Info.hot-add-enabled is true and the virtual machine is running.

hot_add_enabled.description:
Flag indicating whether adding memory while the virtual machine is running is enabled. 
 Some guest operating systems may consume more resources or perform less efficiently when they run on hardware that supports adding memory while the machine is running.

Flag indicating whether adding memory while the virtual machine is running should be enabled. 
 Some guest operating systems may consume more resources or perform less efficiently when they run on hardware that supports adding memory while the machine is running. 

 This field may only be modified if the virtual machine is not powered on.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

size_MiB.description:
New memory size in mebibytes. 
 The supported range of memory sizes is constrained by the configured guest operating system and virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. 

 If the virtual machine is running, this value may only be changed if Memory.Info.hot-add-enabled is true, and the new memory size must satisfy the constraints specified by Memory.Info.hot-add-increment-size-mib and Memory.Info.hot-add-limit-mib.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

spec.description: Specification for updating the memory-related settings of the virtual machine.

This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Parallel.BackingInfo.type is FILE.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual serial port.

auto_detect.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual serial port is configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingInfo.type is HOST_DEVICE.

host_device.description:
Name of the device backing the virtual serial port. 


This field will be unset if Serial.BackingInfo.auto-detect is true and the virtual serial port is not connected or no suitable device is available on the host.

file.description:
Path of the file backing the virtual serial port.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingInfo.type is FILE.

proxy.description:
Proxy service that provides network access to the network backing. If set, the virtual machine initiates a connection with the proxy service and forwards the traffic to the proxy.
If unset, no proxy service is configured.

pipe.description:
Name of the pipe backing the virtual serial port.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingInfo.type is one of PIPE_SERVER or PIPE_CLIENT.

network_location.description:
URI specifying the location of the network service backing the virtual serial port. 
   - If Serial.BackingInfo.type is NETWORK_SERVER, this field is the location used by clients to connect to this server. The hostname part of the URI should either be empty or should specify the address of the host on which the virtual machine is running.
   - If Serial.BackingInfo.type is NETWORK_CLIENT, this field is the location used by the virtual machine to connect to the remote server.
 
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingInfo.type is one of NETWORK_SERVER or NETWORK_CLIENT.

no_rx_loss.description:
Flag that enables optimized data transfer over the pipe. When the value is true, the host buffers data to prevent data overrun. This allows the virtual machine to read all of the data transferred over the pipe with no data loss.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingInfo.type is one of PIPE_SERVER or PIPE_CLIENT.

type.description: Backing type for the virtual serial port.

If unset, the virtual serial port will be configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.

file.description:
Path of the file backing the virtual serial port.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingSpec.type is FILE.

proxy.description:
Proxy service that provides network access to the network backing. If set, the virtual machine initiates a connection with the proxy service and forwards the traffic to the proxy.
If unset, no proxy service should be used.

pipe.description:
Name of the pipe backing the virtual serial port.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingSpec.type is one of PIPE_SERVER or PIPE_CLIENT.

network_location.description:
URI specifying the location of the network service backing the virtual serial port. 
   - If Serial.BackingSpec.type is NETWORK_SERVER, this field is the location used by clients to connect to this server. The hostname part of the URI should either be empty or should specify the address of the host on which the virtual machine is running.
   - If Serial.BackingSpec.type is NETWORK_CLIENT, this field is the location used by the virtual machine to connect to the remote server.
 
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Serial.BackingSpec.type is one of NETWORK_SERVER or NETWORK_CLIENT.

no_rx_loss.description:
Flag that enables optimized data transfer over the pipe. When the value is true, the host buffers data to prevent data overrun. This allows the virtual machine to read all of the data transferred over the pipe with no data loss.
If unset, defaults to false.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.serial.ba.description: The Serial.BackingType enumerated type defines the valid backing types for a virtual serial port.

Physical resource backing for the virtual serial port.
If unset, defaults to automatic detection of a suitable host device.

allow_guest_control.description:
Flag indicating whether the guest can connect and disconnect the device.
Defaults to false if unset.

start_connected.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual device should be connected whenever the virtual machine is powered on.
Defaults to false if unset.

yield_on_poll.description:
CPU yield behavior. If set to true, the virtual machine will periodically relinquish the processor if its sole task is polling the virtual serial port. The amount of time it takes to regain the processor will depend on the degree of other virtual machine activity on the host.
If unset, defaults to false.

upgrade_policy.description:
Scheduled upgrade policy. 
 If set to NEVER, the Hardware.Info.upgrade-version field will be reset to unset.

If unset, the value is unchanged.

upgrade_version.description:
Target hardware version to be used on the next scheduled virtual hardware upgrade. 
 If specified, this field must represent a newer virtual hardware version than the current virtual hardware version reported in Hardware.Info.version.

If Hardware.UpdateSpec.upgrade-policy is set to NEVER, this field must be unset. Otherwise, if this field is unset, default to the most recent virtual hardware version supported by the server.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.upgrade_p.description: The Hardware.UpgradePolicy enumerated type defines the valid virtual hardware upgrade policies for a virtual machine.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.upgrade_s.description: The Hardware.UpgradeStatus enumerated type defines the valid virtual hardware upgrade statuses for a virtual machine.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.version.description: The Hardware.Version enumerated type defines the valid virtual hardware versions for a virtual machine. See https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1003746 (Virtual machine hardware versions (1003746)).

spec.description: Specification for updating the virtual hardware settings of the virtual machine.

version.description:
New virtual machine version.
If unset, defaults to the most recent virtual hardware version supported by the server.

instance_uuid.description: VirtualCenter-specific 128-bit UUID of a virtual machine, represented as a hexademical string. This identifier is used by VirtualCenter to uniquely identify all virtual machine instances, including those that may share the same SMBIOS UUID.

bios_uuid.description: 128-bit SMBIOS UUID of a virtual machine represented as a hexadecimal string in "12345678-abcd-1234-cdef-123456789abc" format.

state.description: Power state of the virtual machine.

clean_power_off.description:
Flag indicating whether the virtual machine was powered off cleanly. This field may be used to detect that the virtual machine crashed unexpectedly and should be restarted.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Power.Info.state is POWERED_OFF.

disks.description:
Identifiers of the virtual machine's virtual disks for which compliance should be checked.
If unset or empty, compliance check is invoked on all the associated disks.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

vm_home.description: Invoke compliance check on the virtual machine home directory if set to true.

disks.description:
The compliance information Compliance.VmComplianceInfo for the virtual machine's virtual disks that are currently associated with a storage policy.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

vm_home.description:
The storage policy compliance information Compliance.VmComplianceInfo for the virtual machine's home directory.
If unset the virtual machine home directory has no storage policy association.

overall_compliance.description: The overall compliance status of the virtual machine and all it's entities.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.storage.policy.com.description: The Compliance.Status enumerated type defines the storage compliance status of a virtual machine and its applicable entities.

failure_cause.description: The exception that caused the compliance check to fail. There can be more than one cause, since a policy can contain capabilities from multiple providers. If empty, it implies no failures while retrieving compliance.

policy.description:
Identifier of the storage policy associated with the virtual machine.
If unset SPBM is unable to retrieve or determine the associated policy, Compliance.VmComplianceInfo.failure-cause is set in such casses.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy.

check_time.description: Date and time of the most recent compliance check.

check_spec.description:
Parameter specifies the entities on which storage policy compliance check is to be invoked. The storage compliance Info Compliance.Info is returned.
If unset, the behavior is equivalent to a Compliance.CheckSpec with CheckSpec#vmHome set to true and CheckSpec#disks populated with all disks attached to the virtual machine.

type.description: Policy type to be used while performing update operation on the virtual disks.

policy.description:
Storage Policy identification.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Policy.DiskPolicySpec.type is USE_SPECIFIED_POLICY.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy.

com.vmware.vcenter.vm.storage.policy.dis.description: The Policy.DiskPolicySpec enumerated type defines the choices for how to specify the policy to be associated with a virtual disk.

disks.description:
Storage policies associated with virtual disks. The values in this map are storage policy identifiers. They will be identifiers for the resource type:com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy If the map is empty, the virtual machine does not have any disks or its disks are not associated with a storage policy.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

vm_home.description:
Storage Policy associated with virtual machine home.
Ifunset, the virtual machine's home directory doesn't have any storage policy.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy.

disks.description:
Storage policy or policies to be used when reconfiguring virtual machine diks.
if unset the current storage policy is retained.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

vm_home.description:
Storage policy to be used when reconfiguring the virtual machine home.
if unset the current storage policy is retained.

type.description: Policy type to be used while performing update operation on the virtual machine home's directory.

policy.description:
Storage Policy identification.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Policy.VmHomePolicySpec.type is USE_SPECIFIED_POLICY.
When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.StoragePolicy.
